instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
hello,

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A motherboard, and there is no liquid damage. During my initial checks, I noticed that <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> was getting hot, and I realized that there was a short circuit in the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> line. I replaced <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, but then I noticed that PI3USB32224BXEAE was getting hot. I removed this component, and I haven't been able to replace it yet. Currently, the motherboard is drawing 5V at 0.021A, and then it goes back to 5V at 0.000A - 5V at 0.021A continuously. Is it happening because PI3USB32224BXEAE is missing, or is it due to a different issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: "I replaced the CD3215C on it with CD3215B. Will there be any issues? Also, these chips don't have any firmware on them, right? Because I installed a brand new product I bought from AliExpress."

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Put the correct "C" version; C00, I suppose.
B03 has different firmware.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
I have it on the donor <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, can I use it? both sides are same
PI3USB32224BXEAE you didn't say anything about it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Board can work without it.
Once booted, replace it; if you note USB 3.0 issues.
